1.description: Sailing east across the Narrow Sea in exile after killing his father. Drinking heavily and contemplating suicide.

14.description: Learns of 'Young Griff' - supposedly Aegon Targaryen, son of Rhaegar, who survived Robert's Rebellion.

relationships.Young Griff: Young man claiming to be Aegon VI

27.description: Captured by Jorah Mormont who plans to bring him to Daenerys. Manipulates the situation to his advantage.

57.description: Enslaved and forced to fight in the fighting pits of Meereen. Uses his wit to survive.

71.description: Becomes advisor to the Second Sons mercenary company, positioning himself for future opportunities.

relationships.Daenerys Targaryen: Absent queen whose throne he eyes

3.description: Serving as Lord Commander of the Night's Watch, making difficult decisions about wildlings and the coming winter.

21.description: Makes controversial decisions to let wildlings through the Wall, facing opposition from his own men.

relationships.Melisandre: Red priestess who sees visions of him

44.description: Sends missions to gather information and allies, including Sam to Oldtown and various rangers on tasks.

relationships.Samwell Tarly: Best friend sent on important mission
relationships.Gilly: Wildling woman whose baby swap he arranged

73.description: Assassinated by his own men during the mutiny at Castle Black after receiving the pink letter from Ramsay.

relationships.Melisandre: Red priestess who may resurrect him

2.description: Struggling to rule Meereen as former slaves and masters clash. Her dragons are growing increasingly difficult to control.

23.description: Agrees to marry Hizdahr zo Loraq to bring peace to Meereen, despite her feelings for Daario.

50.description: At the fighting pits when Drogon attacks. Climbs on his back and flies away from Meereen.

71.description: Stranded in the Dothraki Sea after Drogon flew her away. Captured by a khalasar and faces uncertain fate.

relationships.Drogon: Dragon who abandoned her in the wilderness

4.description: Traveling north beyond the Wall with Hodor, Meera, and Jojen Reed to find the three-eyed crow from his dreams.

34.description: Approaches the cave of the three-eyed crow, facing dangers from wights and the Others.

43.description: Finds the three-eyed crow - actually the Last Greenseer, an ancient being who will teach him his powers.

relationships.Three-Eyed Crow: Ancient greenseer who becomes his teacher
relationships.Children of the Forest: Ancient beings who serve the greenseer
relationships.Jojen Reed: Friend who dies reaching their destination

12.description: Completely broken by Ramsay's torture, now calling himself Reek and serving his tormentor faithfully.

relationships.Roose Bolton: Lord of Winterfell who tolerates him

32.description: Forced to give away 'Arya Stark' (actually Jeyne Poole) at her wedding to Ramsay Bolton.

relationships.Jeyne Poole: Girl forced to pretend to be Arya

51.description: Begins to remember who he was before becoming Reek, stirred by memories of the real Stark family.

relationships.Jeyne Poole: Fellow victim he begins to protect

67.description: Escapes Winterfell with Jeyne Poole by jumping from the walls during Stannis's attack.

9.description: Serves as Stannis's Hand while the king plans his next moves from Castle Black.

29.description: Sent to White Harbor on a dangerous mission to secure the loyalty of Lord Manderly.

54.description: Discovers that Lord Manderly is secretly loyal to the Starks and has been plotting against the Boltons.

14.description: Young man claiming to be Aegon Targaryen, son of Rhaegar, supposedly saved as a baby during Robert's Rebellion.

24.description: Influenced by Tyrion to abandon the original plan and invade Westeros directly instead of seeking Daenerys.

61.description: Lands in the Stormlands and begins his conquest of Westeros with the Golden Company.

14.description: Former Hand of the King exiled by Aerys, now protector of Young Griff. Dying of greyscale.

relationships.Young Griff: Boy he believes is Aegon Targaryen
relationships.Rhaegar Targaryen: Dead prince he loved and failed

24.description: Supports Young Griff's decision to invade Westeros directly, hoping to see him on the throne before greyscale kills him.

6.description: Prince of Dorne traveling to Meereen on a secret mission from his father to marry Daenerys Targaryen.

35.description: Arrives in Meereen to find Daenerys already married to Hizdahr, complicating his mission.

relationships.Hizdahr zo Loraq: Her husband who blocks his plans

68.description: Dies horribly trying to steal one of Daenerys's dragons, burned alive by dragonfire.

23.description: Serves as Daenerys's advisor and protector in Meereen, concerned about the various threats surrounding her.

55.description: Leads the defense of Meereen after Daenerys flies away on Drogon, taking charge of the city.

relationships.Skahaz mo Kandaq: Brazen Beasts commander he works with

70.description: Leads a sortie against the besieging forces, fighting valiantly despite his advanced age.

12.description: Sadistic bastard who has completely broken Theon Greyjoy and turned him into 'Reek' through torture.

32.description: Marries 'Arya Stark' (actually Jeyne Poole) to strengthen Bolton claim to Winterfell.

relationships.Jeyne Poole: Girl he tortures as fake Arya
relationships.Theon Greyjoy: Broken man who gives her away

21.description: Camped at Castle Black, planning his next move to claim the Iron Throne with diminished forces.

42.description: Marches on Winterfell to face the Boltons, struggling through the northern winter.

31.description: Remains at Castle Black while Stannis marches south, seeing visions in her fires of Jon Snow.

relationships.Jon Snow: Lord Commander she sees in flames

73.description: Present at Castle Black when Jon Snow is murdered, potentially able to resurrect him.

relationships.Jon Snow: Murdered Lord Commander she might save

32.description: Lord of Winterfell after betraying the Starks, trying to consolidate Bolton power in the North.

relationships.Ramsay Bolton: Sadistic son he struggles to control
relationships.Jeyne Poole: Fake Arya he uses for legitimacy

67.description: Faces the approaching army of Stannis Baratheon while dealing with internal threats.

recaps.1: Tyrion crosses the Narrow Sea in exile, drinking and contemplating his dark future.
recaps.2: Daenerys struggles to rule Meereen as her dragons become increasingly uncontrollable.
recaps.3: Jon Snow serves as Lord Commander, making difficult decisions about wildlings and winter.
recaps.4: Bran travels beyond the Wall seeking the three-eyed crow with his companions.
recaps.5: Tyrion meets Illyrio Mopatis and learns of new players in the game of thrones.
recaps.6: Quentyn Martell begins his secret journey to Meereen to court Daenerys.
recaps.7: Jon deals with the challenges of integrating wildlings and serving as Lord Commander.
recaps.8: Political developments continue across the realm as various factions maneuver.
recaps.9: Davos serves as Stannis's Hand while the king plans his next campaign.
recaps.10: Various characters adjust to new realities following recent conflicts.
recaps.11: Daenerys faces the ongoing challenges of ruling a conquered city.
recaps.12: Theon, now broken and calling himself Reek, serves his tormentor Ramsay Bolton.
recaps.13: Jon continues making controversial decisions to prepare for winter and the coming threats.
recaps.14: Tyrion meets Young Griff and learns he claims to be Aegon Targaryen, survived heir.
recaps.15: Davos travels to White Harbor on a diplomatic mission for Stannis.
recaps.16: Daenerys considers marriage proposals as her rule of Meereen continues.
recaps.17: Various political developments unfold across the realm.
recaps.18: Young Griff and Jon Connington plan their return to Westeros with the Golden Company.
recaps.19: Developments continue in multiple locations as winter approaches.
recaps.20: Theon struggles with his broken identity while serving the Boltons.
recaps.21: Jon faces increasing opposition from his own men for his wildling policies.
recaps.22: Tyrion continues his journey east, manipulating situations to his advantage.
recaps.23: Daenerys agrees to marry Hizdahr zo Loraq to bring peace to Meereen.
recaps.24: Young Griff decides to invade Westeros directly instead of seeking Daenerys.
recaps.25: Quentyn continues his journey to Meereen with his companions.
recaps.26: Theon begins to remember fragments of his former identity.
recaps.27: Tyrion is captured by Jorah Mormont, who plans to take him to Daenerys.
recaps.28: Political maneuvering continues across the realm as various plots unfold.
recaps.29: Davos navigates the complex politics of White Harbor and Lord Manderly.
recaps.30: Daenerys faces mounting challenges to her rule in Meereen.
recaps.31: Melisandre remains at Castle Black, seeing visions in her fires.
recaps.32: Ramsay Bolton marries 'Arya Stark' with Theon forced to give her away.
recaps.33: Tyrion manipulates his way closer to his goals while traveling east.
recaps.34: Bran approaches his destination beyond the Wall, facing increasing dangers.
recaps.35: Quentyn arrives in Meereen to find Daenerys already married. Jon continues his leadership.
recaps.36: Daenerys prepares for her wedding to Hizdahr despite her reservations.
recaps.37: Theon and Ramsay's wedding night reveals the horror of the situation at Winterfell.
recaps.38: Davos continues his mission in White Harbor with unexpected developments.
recaps.39: Barristan serves Daenerys loyally while concerned about threats around her.
recaps.40: Tyrion finds himself enslaved and heading toward the fighting pits of Meereen.
recaps.41: Theon watches powerlessly as Ramsay tortures his new wife.
recaps.42: Stannis begins his march on Winterfell through the harsh northern winter.
recaps.43: Bran finds the three-eyed crow and begins his mystical training.
recaps.44: Jon sends important missions while facing growing opposition.
recaps.45: Various developments occur as winter deepens across the realm.
recaps.46: Theon struggles with his identity while witnessing horrors at Winterfell.
recaps.47: Tyrion survives in slavery while planning his next moves.
recaps.48: Barristan deals with political challenges in Meereen.
recaps.49: Developments continue across multiple storylines as tensions rise.
recaps.50: At the fighting pits, Drogon attacks and Daenerys flies away on his back.
recaps.51: Theon begins to truly remember who he was before becoming Reek.
recaps.52: Daenerys finds herself alone with Drogon in the Dothraki Sea.
recaps.53: Jon continues his controversial policies while facing increasing resistance.
recaps.54: Davos discovers Lord Manderly's true loyalties and secret plans.
recaps.55: Barristan takes charge of Meereen after Daenerys's disappearance. Quentyn plots.
recaps.56: Theon's memories and identity continue to resurface despite his trauma.
recaps.57: Tyrion becomes involved with the Second Sons mercenary company.
recaps.58: Political developments continue across the realm as winter deepens.
recaps.59: Barristan leads the defense of Meereen against various threats.
recaps.60: Jon continues to face growing opposition from his own men.
recaps.61: Young Griff lands in Westeros and begins his conquest with the Golden Company.
recaps.62: Stannis continues his difficult march through winter toward Winterfell.
recaps.63: Various developments occur as multiple storylines approach climax points.
recaps.64: Davos continues his mission in the North with important discoveries.
recaps.65: Political and military developments continue across the realm.
recaps.66: Tyrion positions himself with the mercenary companies besieging Meereen.
recaps.67: Theon and Jeyne Poole escape Winterfell by jumping from the walls.
recaps.68: Quentyn dies horribly trying to steal one of Daenerys's dragons.
recaps.69: Various storylines continue to develop as conflicts intensify.
recaps.70: Barristan leads military action to defend Meereen against the siege.
recaps.71: Daenerys is captured by a Dothraki khalasar. Tyrion schemes with mercenaries.
recaps.72: Final developments occur as various storylines reach critical points.
recaps.73: Jon Snow is murdered by his own men in a mutiny at Castle Black.
